Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Hill-Cec13 (UCLL1c, XXA, cecropin, natural AMPs;insects, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; Variant H7)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (74.07%) toHill-Cec12GRAVY: -0.27; Mol W: 5590.559; Mol formula: C254H419N75O66; Mol Ex coeff: 11100.Activity: Active against S-aureus ATCC 6538 (MIC >32-64 uM), E. coli ATCC 8739 (MIC 0.5-1.0 uM), P. aeruginos (MIC 1-2 uM).Discovery: a similar sequence has also been reported in a different paper with one extra lysine at the N-terminus. Peptide H7 is active against E. coli ATCC25922 (MIC 0.7 uM), K. pneumoniae ATCC700603 (MIC 2.9 uM), A.baumannii ATCC19606 (MIC 2.9 uM), P-aeruginosa CMCC10104(MIC >25.6 uM), V. parahaemolyticus ATCC17802 (MIC 2.9 uM), E-faecalis ATCC29212 (MIC >25.6 uM), B. subtilis BNCC109047 (MIC 0.7 uM), S-epidermidis ATCC35984 (MIC >25.6 uM), S-aureus ATCC6538 (MIC >25.6 uM), and C-albicans ATCC10231 (MIC > 25.6 uM) (Peng et al., 2023). Updated 12/2023
Literature Information.Author: Van Moll L, De Smet J, Paas A, Tegtmeier D, Vilcinskas A, Cos P, Van Campenhout L.2022
Literature Information.Title: In Vitro Evaluation of Antimicrobial Peptides from the Black Soldier Fly (Hermetia Illucens) against a Selection of Human Pathogens.
